title: Ticket #3665: Port standard universe to Debian 7.
remarks:
2013-May-29 11:43:26 by tlmiller:
I told LIGO I'd know how long the port would take by 2013-06-04. Current status: the clipped port is failing a stack of tests.

2013-May-30 14:23:19 by tlmiller:
After adjusting LD_LIBRARY_PATH and correcting some fairly bizarre build errors (libvomsapi was built but not copied to the lib directory), the clipped port is down to four failing tests.

(Note: I'm presently assuming that a clipped build will Just Work when built in BaTLab, and that the issues I corrected have to do with running the tests by hand; I haven't attempted to investigate the reason(s) for the failures.)

2013-May-30 15:09:49 by tlmiller:
Corrected lib_userlog by explicitly setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH in the submit file.

Re-running lib_eventlog_base required removing a directory that wasn't cleaned up from the fist attempt.

2013-May-31 11:09:03 by tlmiller:
Will not further investigate job_filexfer_md5-remote_van hanging (and failing due to a time-out): the test job's Disk requirement is never met because my VM is almost full.

2013-May-31 11:13:08 by tlmiller:
Fixed condor_view_classad_types by removing the (invalid) forward resolution of the VM's hostname from /etc/hosts.

This could also be fixed by additional cleverness in the test configuration (ALLOW_CONFIG was insufficiently broad), but since that line in /etc/hosts causes HTCondor problems anyways...

2013-Jun-06 16:12:51 by tlmiller:
Stalled until 2013-06-12, when Jaime returns, because of raging OpenStack fires.

2013-Jun-17 15:52:14 by tlmiller:
Current status: successfully linked the standard universe and its test binaries, bullying them into actually running.

Run the standard universe tests.

2013-Jun-26 17:25:43 by tlmiller:
Standard universe tests succesful; added LIGO test to Debian 7, which also passes; run ID 141879 and the associated tests should be the final acceptance test.

MILESTONE

Commit code to branch from 8.0.x for review.

2013-Jun-27 14:20:16 by tlmiller:
GregT suggested, rather than deprive you of the favorite part of your job (picking a victim), that I could just assign /you/ the code review, so that if I were wrong, it'd be easy to fix. :)

2013-Jul-03 14:59:57 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW STEP 1

Before I go any further on the code review, where I can see the results of the regression test suite against this branch? Is there an NMI build ID / URL with the test results?

Another issue is was the job_ligo_x86-64-chkpttst-1 test from the test suite pass on Debian 7? This tests a primary LIGO application in standard universe. Looks like it has only ever run on RHEL5, but I would really want to see it green on Debian7.

Thanks

2013-Jul-03 15:11:18 by tlmiller: 
> Before I go any further on the code review, where I can see the results of the
> regression test suite against this branch? Is there an NMI build ID / URL with
> the test results?

Of course. 141893 is the build. As of right now, the dashboard has it listed under personal runs; the list of test runs using that build ID can be found here:

http://submit-2.batlab.org/nmi/results/overview?usedRunID=141893

although the dashboard view is handier. For comparison, the dashboard as the "ultra-clipped" daily results going back to Monday afternoon. (The consistent failure of the SSH-to-job test is a problem with the test.) 

> Another issue is was the job_ligo_x86-64-chkpttst-1 test from the test suite
> pass on Debian 7? This tests a primary LIGO application in standard universe.
> Looks like it has only ever run on RHEL5, but I would really want to see it
> green on Debian7.

As you can see at the URL below, the LIGO test passes on Debian 7.

http://submit-2.batlab.org/nmi/results/details?runID=141910

2013-Jul-09 16:06:12 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Looks good! Except for missing Version History entry and updating the list of supported platforms in Chap 1 of the Manual.

Question: did you run analyze_syscalls script to figure out if any new glibc 213 specificness happened beyond what was needed for glibc 212?

2013-Jul-17 11:50:57 by tlmiller:
Karen is adding x86-64 Debian 7 (wheezy) to the list of supported platforms.

syscalls review still needs to happen.
check_ins:
2013-Aug-14 10:57   Check-in [37209]: debian 7.0 (wheezy) added to manual ===GT=== #3665 (By Karen Miller )
2013-Jul-10 10:01   Check-in [36844]: (#3665) Add missing glibc 2.13-38 patches. (By Todd L Miller )
2013-Jul-09 14:23   Check-in [36833]: (#3665) Add new port to version history. Probably need to do other things, as well. (By Todd L Miller )
2013-Jun-26 17:39   Check-in [36693]: (#3665) Debian 7 full port. No absinthe was harmed in the making of this port. (By Todd L Miller )
creator: tlmiller
